title: Introducing the Riot Games Engineering Tech Blog

replies.body: For everyone on the west coast that is making a big deal about the server move you need to take a seat and listen up.  The east coast has been having insanely high ping for how long???  Some have gotten over 200 ping and now because you have 60 its such a big deal?  I am a west coast player from Canada and I find the people appalling who are talking about quitting because of the ping.  Suck it up and play because this isn't an unfair move, it was the best thing riot could have done for the community and I am grateful for that.  I can live with 60 ping... Can you?{{summoner:30}}

Amen to that brother... I'm east coast and went from 120 ping for TWO YEARS to 60 ping and i consider the 60 ping to be a godsend.  This is the best ping I've ever had in my entire history of league and i don't understand how anybody could complain about anything above 100.  I'm missing skill shots because i'm so used to the lag but it's great because now my aim actually determines whether the skill hits and i don't have to guess half a second ahead of time anymore.  To all of those with "high ping" right now on the west coast, i've had higher than that since the beginning of league and this is a very welcome change for my side of the US.  Also, your ping is still better than mine was before the new server.
RIP HAWAII WE ALREADY HAD BAD PING.

well uh, your on a island.. 
how does Hawaii even get internet anyways?
Giant Under Water Cable
120 ms = .12 sec.. not .5
You are from Canada and you don't say "sorry"? WHAT ARE YOU?
On behalf of all Canadians i apologize eh, would you like a beaver tail and some poutine? I can bring it down to you on my polar bear
can i get some maple syrup also?{{item:2041}}
Meanwhile in Alaska...
That's good for you. I had 60 ping in Los Angeles before the change. Now I have 100-150 and 500ping lag spikes every two minutes. 60-80 ping? What a bliss.

You guys should really read the information Riot is kind enough to give out.  They said that folks all over the states might still have to deal with fluctuating pings, as well as higher then normal pings, due to the fact that they're still building their dedicated network.  Add to that they mentioned the fact that they are still working on some of the major network carriers (Verizon, AT&T, etc) to get them on the same page with the dedicated communication lines for players, and you have..... TADA UNREASONABLE PINGS.... which they predicted WOULD happen (not might, WOULD).
TL; DR if you life in California youre gunna have a bad time

60 ping..? I have a 60mb internet line on top of living in California and I used get 30-40 ping. I'm now getting around 80-100 ping. Riot said they expected maybe a 30ish ping increase, but for quite a few, it's a much, much, much bigger jump. I don't know why they don't just have two different servers. EU has an EU West and an EU North East on top of a Russian server. Europe by itself isn't exactly the size of the US let alone covering all of NA.
Dude, 80-100 ping is good for normal play. Theres no noticeable delay at all lmao..
What are the pros going to do? Will they sell their houses and just move to Illinois? I mean that kinda sucks because it's really nice to live in California and moving there is a total life change.
Dude When the server moved my ping went from 80 to 200 so don't think that that has solved ping issues I think riot should just make two north american servers

I have been playing in Vermont since beta.
That is 6 years with a ping over 100, usually 110-120.
With the move I am now getting 60ms or less, I would have been happy with 80.
I think they made a good choice and I'm sure over the coming months that will show in overall game experience.
I guarantee they will not neglect their West Coast customers, and if there are persistent ping issues, they will fix them.
The West is one of their biggest customer bases, but think about NYC, Boston, and Florida for example.
This is for the greater good, leveling the playing field all around.
So true my ping is always around 70~150 never had problems.
Meanwhile, in Korea... 180 ms

you know, ive spent hundreds of dollars on this game, and i know tens of thousands of others have too, youre so greedy that you had to MOVE the server rather than just put another one there? thats just wrong, my ping and the ping of so many others went up because of this move because you wouldnt just add another server out there and improve EVERYONES connection

I don't think you understand how wide area networks function, especially if you honestly think just slapping a couple of server cabinets into a farm is a fix. I suggest you read a blog about it; I hear Riot is making one.

Thats gonna be a bit hard.. {{champion:54}}

I think this is great move I live on the west coast I accually lived 3 hours away from the old server location. I had 10-25 ping depending on the day. I now have 55-67 ping and I'm happy about that to be able to play on even ground now with some of the east coast players that had 100+ ping now its a game where you need at least some skill to outdo your lane opponent if their across the country.

servers that big and powerful are expensive, thank you riot for your hard effort to try to find a middle ground to make things overall better for everyone... that being said im still waiting for battlecast malzahar lol. Thanks again for looking at the bigger picture.
I'm pining at 21 from the upper peninsula of Michigan!!!  OH YEAH!

I live in California and i was fine with the server moving but now that it has happened, i cant even enjoy a game. i use to be at 50 to 60 but now I'm at 130-180 and it jumps frequent. i already have everything at the lowest setting(always did) its just the servers or something. it freezes for a second and i miss a bunch of cs and almost die..not fun at all..  i don't know please help if you can, i guess lol?{{champion:150}}
setting has nothing to do with ping no? lol
Why is my ping higher even though I'm closer to Chicago than Los Angeles, it went up by about 40. My old ping was 50-55 and now it's 90-95. Please help!!!

It's too soon to tell if it's actually due to the migration. If it persists for days or weeks, then it's an issue, but right now it could be just a coincidence. There are just too many variables in a network of this scale.
plus, it isn't like the internet goes in a straight line through the air to your house. The move while being a straight line could have been put closer, but in actuality been put further away.
You........ I'm playing on the east coast region for 4 years and my ping was 90-110 before the migration. HARDLY any delay and I don't understand why your need help.

As a player who has had a constant 200~ ping throughout the last year, I love Riot. They have lowered my ping by about 140 so now I play at the Average(ish) ping in NA. It's a shame that we all have to be average and that certain players can't get a geological advantage over others anymore though.

And what did they do to the west cost players? Raise it by 40? It is ridiculous that they think that that is fair. 

Thanks Riot :D
